results.title: Report
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
Indication of the dangers faced by employees jumping to incorrect conclusions based on second-hand and unreliable information from the Union delegate about management’s intentions.

results.title: Repetitive strain injuries at work
results.creator_credit: Kim Dalton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the reasons for repetitive strain injuries and discusses the symptoms and treatment of RSI. Sufferers describe the activities which led to their injuries and doctors talk about methods of prevention.

group_works.title: Repairing an upholstered chair
group_works.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company

results.title: Repairing an upholstered chair
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of how to mend an upholstered armchair when the seat is sagging or collapsed. A series of shots show the successive stages of building up the armchair on its wooden frame. Following this, a man is seen examining the seat of an armchair that needs repair. Work is started on the inverted chair, removing canvas and old webbing, refastening the springs, replacing the old webbing and stitching the springs to the new webbing, finally replacing the canvas cover. All stages of the operation are shown and explained.

group_siblings.title: Repairing a window pane
group_siblings.creator_credit: Topical Film Company

results.title: Repairing a window pane
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of replacing a broken window pane. The film shows the tools required for the job and the whole process in order of procedure, taking out the sash of an upstairs window, measuring the pane, removing the old putty from the rebate and painting the bare wood exposed and fixing the new glass with putty.

results.title: Repairing a sashcord
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of replacing a broken sashcord. An introductory sequence explains the difference between casement and sliding sash windows. A working model shows the structure of the latter. A man is seen in an upstairs room at work renewing a broken sashcord. Each stage of the job is illustrated in detail. Finally the film shows the tools which were used and summarises the method.

results.title: Renmark on the river
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents Renmark as Australia’s first irrigation settlement. Introduces the Renmark Trust utilizing the waters of the Murray River to irrigate fruit trees and vines. We see oranges prepared for market whilst other fruits include apricots, peaches, pears, lemons and grapefruit; and vineyards produce sultanas, raisins, and grapes for wine making. The scenic attractions of the River and town are also seen.

results.title: Remembering Jacqueline du Pre
results.brief_description: The life of cellist Jacqueline du Pre was tragically cut short when she died of multiple sclerosis, aged 28. This film contains footage of du Pre in her element, practicing amongst friends and performing to receptive and adoring audiences. The second half of the program features performances. Extracts include Brahms: Sonata No.2 in F, Op.99; Offenbach: Duos for two cellos; Beethoven: Sonata No.3 in A, Op.69; Schubert: Piano Quintet in A, D.667 “The Trout”; Beethoven: Piano Trio No.5 in D, Op.70 No.1 “The Ghost”; Elgar: and Cello Concerto in E minor, Op.85.
results.description: The life of cellist Jacqueline du Pre was tragically cut short when she died of multiple sclerosis, aged 28. results.title: Remembering it all
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Makes a recapitulation of all the points given in the previous eleven films, to show the responsibilities undertaken by a driver to check his car for roadworthiness, and to drive in a sensible, considerate manner by following the system of car control. Features First Constable Geoff Caine as The Driver.
